article_title: Last Call: That Was Then, This Is Now
article_text:
Today in Obama:

While we’re waiting for President Barack Obama to drop an executive order reforming immigration without Congressional approval, the New York Times reminds us that the president once declared he couldn’t reform immigration without Congressional approval.

With Obama in meetings all day, he left it to his chief of staff, John Podesta, to wave the veto pen at Congress ahead of an anticipated vote over the Keystone XL pipeline, even though Democrats are one vote shy of the 60 they need to pass the bill.

Today in Obamacare:

It’s the law that conservatives love to hate and the public hates to love: Obamacare open enrollment began over the weekend. And unlike last year’s debacle, the website functioned without a hitch, signing up about 100,000 people. Yet politically, the law is still as unpopular as ever, with seriously underwater poll numbers....

article_metadata.title: Last Call: That Was Then, This Is Now

og.description: Obama does a 180 on immigration, Hillary and working-class whites, Pelosi gives Boehner some b-day shade.
